FINDINGS: Around the periphery of the image, there is a well-circumscribed, round mass with a smooth contour and dense internal calcifications. The mass measures approximately 1.5 cm in diameter. No distortion or skin thickening is noted in the surrounding tissue. This finding suggests a benign calcified fibroepithelial lesion (BIRADS 4B). However, due to its size and density, short-term follow-up is recommended for confirmation of stability.
